intro: Erythrospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Erythrospermum lanceolatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
